body_html:
@drpngx Thanks a lot!

Here is the code: https://github.com/anjiefang/examplecodes_tensorflow.git

  1. By running ./download_data.sh, a sample data will be download and save in folder data
  2. Convert images to tf-records: python convert_image.py ./data (tf-records files will be store under ./data/)
  3. Train the model: python prediction_train.py --data_dir ./data (only the tf-records files will be read)
body_text:
@drpngx  Thanks a lot!
Here is the code: https://github.com/anjiefang/examplecodes_tensorflow.git

By running ./download_data.sh, a sample data will be download and save in folder data
Convert images to tf-records:  python convert_image.py ./data (tf-records files will be store under ./data/)
Train the model: python prediction_train.py --data_dir ./data (only the tf-records files will be read)
body:
@drpngx  Thanks a lot! 

Here is the code: https://github.com/anjiefang/examplecodes_tensorflow.git
1. By running `./download_data.sh`, a sample data will be download and save in folder `data`
2. Convert images to `tf-records`:  `python convert_image.py ./data` (`tf-records` files will be store under `./data/`)
3. Train the model: `python prediction_train.py --data_dir ./data` (only the `tf-records` files will be read)
